_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
January 3rd, 1:45 PM
Good afternoon Sugarbush skiers and riders! We've picked up another 4 inches of fresh goodness over the last 24 hours, and flurries continue to shower the mountain. Exciting news, Sunny Quad made its debut this morning with an astonishing freestyle setup from the Park's crew including 34 features and 2 jumps on Riemergasse, and another 15 features will be added for tomorrow. Forecast for tomorrow calls for another cold one, cloudy skies will be accompanied by temps of mid to low teens at the base and single digits at the summit. You can look forward to getting down on a plethora of beautiful groomers tomorrow, along with packed powder conditions on natural terrain. Snowmaking at Lincoln Peak will be coming off Stein's tonight and moving to Birch Run. At Mt. Ellen snowmaking will be turning off on Cruiser and Crackerjack and moving to Northridge Expressway. Ripcord's snowmaking whales will be groomed out tonight. Please use caution around snowmaking, as conditions vary and visibility is low.

We have over 450 skiable acres served by 13 lifts and 108 open trails, with 37 of those getting a fresh corduroy overnight. Northridge Express lift will be closed tomorrow. Hiking at Castlerock will be open from 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM tomorrow. Ropes dropped on tons of natural terrain this week including Moonshine, Hammerhead, Tumbler, The Mall and more. This terrain is suggested for experts only as base coverage is thin and conditions are variable.

Operations are in the last day of holiday hours, which means GMX, Super Bravo and Heaven's Gate are our early birds, loading at 8:00 AM. Followed by all other scheduled lifts at 9:00 AM, with the exception of Inverness, which will open to the public at 1:00 PM. The freestyle setup on Straightshot at Mt. Ellen will remain open with 15 features and 2 jumps. Plus, Slowpoke and Sugarbear Forest at Lincoln Peak are home to 13 total features, and newly installed side hits!  Join us today, Jan 3rd at Castlerock Pub for a tasting with Athletic Brewing Company, a great way to celebrate the new year with resolutions in mind. Check out all of our winter events!

All uphill routes are open at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen, check out our uphill travel policy for more info. *Lincoln Peak evening route will stop at the top of Gate House, due to snowmaking on North Lynx terrain*
